item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (272 points | 81 comments)
2. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (227 points | 324 comments)
3. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (333 points | 138 comments)
4. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (777 points | 294 comments)
5. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (207 points | 28 comments)
6. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (190 points | 125 comments)
7. Microsoft gets twitchy over talk of Europe's tech independence (59 points | 35 comments)
8. Linux Kernel Exploitation: Attack of the Vsock (203 points | 55 comments)
9. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (366 points | 347 comments)
10. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (223 points | 180 comments)
11. A competing theory to 'dark energy' suggests universe has different time zones (48 points | 17 comments)
12. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (150 points | 37 comments)
13. Xiaomi MiMo Reasoning Model (453 points | 165 comments)
14. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (645 points | 361 comments)
15. I Found Malware in a BeamNG Mod (110 points | 16 comments)
16. Someone at YouTube needs glasses (1207 points | 630 comments)
17. Reversible computing with mechanical links and pivots (143 points | 64 comments)

20. GroMo (YC W21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
21. You Wouldn't Download a Hacker News (412 points | 216 comments)
22. Future of OSU Open Source Lab in Jeopardy (242 points | 78 comments)
23. Show HN: Create your own finetuned AI model using Google Sheets (120 points | 39 comments)
24. Show HN: Convert Large CSV/XLSX to JSON or XML in Browser (28 points | 8 comments)
25. Company built its own rail terminal in NYC to avoid relying on trucks (97 points | 26 comments)
26. Stockhausen: Sounds in Space (26 points | 3 comments)
27. The True Size Of (261 points | 121 comments)
28. Show HN: ART – a new open-source RL framework for training agents (96 points | 12 comments)
29. Julia Parsons, U.S. Navy Code Breaker During World War II, Dies at 104 (138 points | 10 comments)
30. The Secret Services' involvement in the making of The Line of Fire (1993) [pdf] (6 points | discuss)
